segment.source: Instructional UI guidelines
segment.target: Instructional UI guidelines

segment.source: In some circumstances it can be helpful to teach the user about functions in your app that might not be obvious to them, such as specific touch interactions.
segment.target: In some circumstances it can be helpful to teach the user about functions in your app that might not be obvious to them, such as specific touch interactions.

segment.source: In these cases, you need to present instructions to the user through the user interface (UI), so that they can use those features they might have missed.
segment.target: In these cases, you need to present instructions to the user through the user interface (UI), so that they can use those features they might have missed.

segment.source: When to use instructional UI
segment.target: When to use instructional UI

segment.source: Instructional UI has to be used carefully.
segment.target: Instructional UI has to be used carefully.

segment.source: When overused, it can be easily ignored or annoy the user, causing it to be ineffective.
segment.target: When overused, it can be easily ignored or annoy the user, causing it to be ineffective.

segment.source: Instructional UI should be used to help the user discover important and non-obvious features of your app, such as touch gestures or settings they may be interested in.
segment.target: Instructional UI should be used to help the user discover important and non-obvious features of your app, such as touch gestures or settings they may be interested in.

segment.source: It can also be used to inform users about new features or changes in your app that they might have otherwise overlooked.
segment.target: It can also be used to inform users about new features or changes in your app that they might have otherwise overlooked.

segment.source: Unless your app is dependent on touch gestures, instructional UI should not be used to teach users the fundamental features of your app.
segment.target: Unless your app is dependent on touch gestures, instructional UI should not be used to teach users the fundamental features of your app.

segment.source: Principles of writing instructional UI
segment.target: Principles of writing instructional UI

segment.source: Good instructional UI is relevant and educational to the user, and enhances the user experience.
segment.target: Good instructional UI is relevant and educational to the user, and enhances the user experience.

segment.source: It should be:
segment.target: It should be:

segment.source: Simple: Users don't want their experience to be interrupted with complicated information
segment.target: Simple: Users don't want their experience to be interrupted with complicated information

segment.source: Memorable: Users don't want to see the same instructions every time they attempt a task, so instructions need to be something they'll remember.
segment.target: Memorable: Users don't want to see the same instructions every time they attempt a task, so instructions need to be something they'll remember.

segment.source: Immediately relevant: If the instructional UI doesn't teach a user about something that they immediately want to do, they won't have a reason to pay attention to it.
segment.target: Immediately relevant: If the instructional UI doesn't teach a user about something that they immediately want to do, they won't have a reason to pay attention to it.

segment.source: Avoid overusing instructional UI, and be sure to choose the right topics.
segment.target: Avoid overusing instructional UI, and be sure to choose the right topics.

segment.source: Do not teach:
segment.target: Do not teach:

segment.source: Fundamental features: If a user needs instructions to use your app, consider making the app design more intuitive.
segment.target: Fundamental features: If a user needs instructions to use your app, consider making the app design more intuitive.

segment.source: Obvious features: If a user can figure out a feature on their own without instruction, then the instructional UI will just get in the way.
segment.target: Obvious features: If a user can figure out a feature on their own without instruction, then the instructional UI will just get in the way.

segment.source: Complex features: Instructional UI needs to be concise, and users interested in complex features are usually willing to seek out instructions and don't need to be given them.
segment.target: Complex features: Instructional UI needs to be concise, and users interested in complex features are usually willing to seek out instructions and don't need to be given them.

segment.source: Avoid inconveniencing the user with your instructional UI.
segment.target: Avoid inconveniencing the user with your instructional UI.

segment.source: Do not:
segment.target: Do not:

segment.source: Obscure important information: Instructional UI should never get in the way of other features of your app.
segment.target: Obscure important information: Instructional UI should never get in the way of other features of your app.

segment.source: Force users to participate: Users should be able to ignore instructional UI and still progress through the app.
segment.target: Force users to participate: Users should be able to ignore instructional UI and still progress through the app.

segment.source: Displaying repeat information: Don't harass the user with instructional UI, even if they ignore it the first time.
segment.target: Displaying repeat information: Don't harass the user with instructional UI, even if they ignore it the first time.

segment.source: Adding an setting to display instructional UI again is a better solution.
segment.target: Adding an setting to display instructional UI again is a better solution.
